alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 01 at 2:27PM MDT until April 03 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM SUNDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF THE REGION DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An extended period of widespread critical fire weather conditions will impact the region through Tuesday. The focus will be across eastern NM through Sunday before spreading to much of the region Monday. Critical fire weather may persist into Monday night across parts of eastern NM before redeveloping over many areas Tuesday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (101), West Central Mountains (105), West Central Basin and Range (109), Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Upper Rio Grande Valley (121), and the Sandia and Manzano Mountains (124) from Monday morning through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts of 50 to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 10 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
